content: spiderman boggy creek blanket blanket #1 of the superhero blankets for superhero kids designed by melanie blager my little yarn on the prairie 2024 this blanket is designed to meet the size requirements for boggy creek camp the blanket is crocheted in the round to a size of 40 x 40 101 6 cm x 101 6 cm using 100% acrylic yarn in worsted weight medium 4 and 3 colours webbing is surface crocheted onto the blanket after completely the striping rounds a spider applique with a heart centre is sewn on after the blanket is completed materials suggested yarns colours and amounts to purchase classic spiderman colours blanket shown above a mainstay acrylic yarn red v #4 weight 198 4 g/7 oz 363 m/397 yds 1 skein b mainstay acrylic yarn blue v #4 weight 198 4 g/7 oz 363 m/397 yds 2 skeins c mainstay acrylic yarn black v #4 weight 198 4 g /7 oz 363 m/397 yds 1 skein light spiderwoman colours blanket shown above a bernat supervalue baby pink #4 weight 197 g/7 oz 389 5 m426 yds 1 skein b bernat supervalue sky blue #4 weight 197 g/7 oz 389 5 m426 yds 2 skein c bernat supervalue true grey #4 weight 197 g/7 oz 389 5 m426 yds 1 skein bright spiderwoman colours blanket a bernat supervalue peony pink #4 weight 197 g/7 oz 389 5 m/426 yds 1 skein b bernat supervalue bright blue #4 weight 197 g/7 oz 389 5 m/426 yds 2 skein c bernat premium sky grey #4 weight 198 g/7 oz 329 2 m/360 yds 1 skein white webbing spiderman blanket a mainstay acrylic yarn red v #4 weight 198 4 g/7 oz 363 m/397 yds 1 skein b mainstay acrylic yarn blue v #4 weight 198 4 g/7 oz 363 m/397 yds 2 skeins c mainstay acrylic yarn white v#4 weight 198 4 g/7 oz 363 m/397 yds 1 skein for every blanket you will need recommend a 6 5 to 7 mm hook for blanket to match the classic spiderman colour blanket 5 0 to 5 5 hook for spider applique stitch markers darning needle scissors gauge gauge pattern work in blanket pattern of decrease c1 repeated across swatch crochet back and forth in row you will need an even number plus 4 for your first chain in order to end each row with a single double_crochet the first decrease is placed into the chain space of the pattern below 6 5 decrease c1 and 6 row = 4 x4 10 cm x 10 cm definitions us terms c = chain double_crochet = double_crochet decrease = double_crochet 2 together dcinc = double_crochet increase 2 double_crochet in the same stich fo = fasten_off and cut yarn magic_ring = magic_ring r = round # single_crochet = single_crochet scinc = single_crochet increase 2 single_crochet in the same stitch stsc = standing single_crochet ssc = stacked single_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch yo = yarn over = stitch pattern to be repeated
